# Plots with ggplot2

We are going to make plots in R and it's going to be amazing.

```{r include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
library(here)
library(readr)
```

```{r include=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
ca_np <- read_csv(here("data", "ca_np.csv"))
ci_np <- read_excel(here("data", "ci_np.xlsx"))


```
```{r echo=FALSE}
gg_base <- ggplot(data = ci_np, aes(x = year, y = visitors))

gg_base +
  geom_line(linetype = "dotted") +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(
    x = "Year",
    y = "Annual park visitors",
    title = "Channel Islands NP Visitation",
    subtitle = "(1963 - 2016)"
  )

gg_base +   # scatterplot
  geom_point(color = "purple",
             pch = 17,
             size = 4,
             alpha = 0.5) 
  
gg_base +     # Column
  geom_col(color = "tan2",
           size = 1,
           alpha = 0.5
    
  )    

gg_base +     # Area
  geom_area( color = "coral",
             size = 1,
             alpha = 0.5
    
  )    

gg_base + 
  geom_point(
    aes(size = visitors,
        color = visitors),
    alpha = 0.5
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

gg_base + 
  geom_col(aes(fill = visitors))

gg_base +
  geom_line(color = "purple") +
  geom_point(color = "orange",
             aes(size = year),
             alpha = 0.5)

# Or, combine a column and line graph (not sure why youâ€™d want to do this, but you can):


gg_base +
  geom_col(fill = "orange",
           color = "purple") +
  geom_line(color = "green")

# The code below is different form the codes above!

ggplot(data = ca_np, aes(x = year, y = visitors, group = park_name)) +
  geom_line()

gg_np <- ggplot(data = ca_np, aes(x = year, y = visitors, group = park_name))

# gg_np + geom_line(color = park_name)  this code is not working

gg_np +
  geom_line(show.legend = FALSE) +
  theme_light() + 
  labs(x = "year", y = "annual visitors") +
  facet_wrap(~ park_name)

  
ggsave(here("figures", "np_graph.jpg"), dpi = 180, width = 8, height = 7)
```
